meanings.definition: A structure with a shape that produces lift when moving through a fluid, typically used on aircraft wings.
meanings.sent1: The aerofoil on the airplane wing helps it stay up in the air.
meanings.sent2: The engineer designed the aerofoil to make the plane fly smoothly.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous squirrel tried to use the aerofoil as a slide, but it didn't work.
meanings.sent4: Her words were like an aerofoil, lifting his spirits higher with each sentence.
meanings.sent5: The aerofoil's curved shape is like a magic carpet carrying the plane through the sky.

meanings.definition: To equip with aerofoils for improved aerodynamic performance.
meanings.sent1: The mechanics will aerofoil the new aircraft for better speed.
meanings.sent2: They aerofoil the car to make it more fuel-efficient.
meanings.sent3: He jokingly said he would aerofoil his bicycle to race the wind.
meanings.sent4: Her determination to succeed aerofoiled any obstacles in her path.
meanings.sent5: The team's unity aerofoiled their competitors' attempts to divide them.
